newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-ROGAN BACK IN NORTHERN IRELAND SQUAD.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ROGAN BACK IN NORTHERN IRELAND SQUAD.

text.p: Defender Anton Rogan was recalled to international duty for Northern Ireland for the first time in four-and-a-half years on Wednesday, to replace Keith Rowland in the squad for Saturday's World Cup qualifier against Germany.
The 30-year-old Rogan, who plays for London side Millwall, won the last of his 17 caps when he came on as a substitute against Lithuania in April 1992.
West Ham fullback Rowland dropped out of the 18-man squad travelling to Nuremberg for the group nine match because of a septic throat.
